title: AI tools predict seizure outcomes in mouse models by recognizing fine motor differences
description: In a new study, researchers at The Ohio State University used artificial intelligence (AI) tools to predict seizure outcomes in mouse models.
content:
In a new study, researchers at The Ohio State University used artificial intelligence (AI) tools to predict seizure outcomes in mouse models.
Seizures may cause temporary disruptions in motor control, which typically follow certain behavioral pattern... [2338 chars]

title: ‘AI actor’ Tilly Norwood stirs outrage in Hollywood
description: The artificial intelligence-created character is a product of the company Xicoia. It has faced immediate backlash from guilds, actors, and filmmakers.
content:
NEW YORK — Like thousands of actors, Tilly Norwood is looking for a Hollywood agent.
But unlike most young performers aspiring to make it in the film industry, Tilly Norwood is an entirely artificial intelligence-made character. Norwood, dubbed Holly... [4626 chars]

title: Stocks Rally Further as AI Deal Spree Rolls On: Markets Wrap
description: (Bloomberg) -- A tech-fueled rally in global stocks continued unabated as another round of big-ticket artificial intelligence deals and partnerships stoked fresh optimism.
content:

title: AI startup valuations raise bubble fears as funding surges
description: SINGAPORE (Reuters) -Artificial intelligence startups are attracting record sums of venture capital, but some of the world's largest investors warned that early-stage valuations are starting to look frothy, senior investment executives said on Friday.

title: Nvidia and Fujitsu agree to work together on AI robots and other technology
description: U.S. technology company Nvidia and Fujitsu, a Japanese telecommunications and computer maker, agreed Friday to work together on artificial intelligence to deliver smart robots and a variety of other innovations using Nvidia's computer chips.
content:
TOKYO — U.S. technology company Nvidia and Fujitsu, a Japanese telecommunications and computer maker, agreed Friday to work together on artificial intelligence to deliver smart robots and a variety of other innovations using Nvidia's computer chips.

title: LinkedIn CEO says your fancy college degree not enough, focus on this to land jobs fast
description: LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky advices young professionals that proficiency with artificial intelligence and the ability to adapt now carry more weight than a fancy degree from a top-tier academic university.
